page.title: 08WILDLIFE AROUND NEYLAND 1
page.content: Running alongside the Marina at {Westfield Pill}is the old{Neyland}to {Haverfordwest}railway line. This is a grand place to see local wildlife. There have been lots of changes in order to create the new Marina. A dam has been built across the valley just above the Westfield Pill Bridge. Many of the rare{Small{Blue}butterflies have died out because{their habitat {was destroyed}by covering it with mud when building the Marina. It is hoped that this area will become a{nature reserve}but nothing has been done, as yet, to carry out this plan. As you walk towards{Rosemarket,}on the left is a large pool. This pool used to be slightly salty, but should now become fresh, and provide a habitat for a wide range of plants and animals.
